dict.acceptation: 难对付的，棘手的；笨拙的，不灵活的；不顺手的；不优美的；

sent.orig: GORING. My dear Robert, it's a very awkward business, very awkward indeed.
sent.trans: （余）戈林子爵：我亲爱的罗伯特，这是一笔非常笨拙的生意，的确非常笨拙。

sent.orig: According to awkward definition, actually real-estate industry itself is a kind of awkward existence.
sent.trans: 按照尴尬定义，其实房地产行业本身就是一种尴尬的存在。

sent.orig: An awkward pause followed his remark.
sent.trans: 他讲了话，接着是一片让人尴尬的沉寂。

sent.orig: Aunt Lena came to visit us at an awkward time.
sent.trans: 丽娜大婶在我们很不方便的时候来了。
